description: Erection of a single storey rear extension, converting garage to habitable room, front porch, conversion of roofspace to habitable use to include rear dormer and conversion from hip to gable.
decision_conditions: The proposed hip to gable end conversion and rear dormer, by reason of its design, scale, size, bulk and massing, and would appear as disproportionate and incongruous addition that would fail to respect the original roof form and architectural composition of the original dwelling, and would be detrimental to the character, appearance and visual amenities of the surrounding area. The proposal would therefore be contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012) and Policies DMHB 11, DMHB 12 and DMHD 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020) and Policy D4 of the London Plan (2021).

The proposed roof alterations/extensions, single storey rear and front extension, alongside  the existing extensions, by reason of the size, scale, bulk and design, would appear as incongruous form of development that would fail to harmonise with the architectural composition of the original dwelling and would be detrimental to the character, appearance and visual amenities of the street scene and surrounding area. The proposal, therefore, conflicts with Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 11, DMHB 12 and DMHD 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan - Part Two (2020) and Policy D4 of the London Plan (2021).

The proposeds extensions, by reason of its size, scale, bulk, height, massing and proximity would have a harmful impact on the living conditions of No. 17 and No. 21 Boldmere Road and their private amenity space, in terms of outlook, over dominance, and overbearing effect. The proposal would therefore be contrary to Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012) and Policies DMHD 1 and DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020).
